intro: Sideroxylon persimile, commonly known as the African ironwood, is a large evergreen tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its dense, hard wood that is highly valued for its durability. The tree has compound leaves with opposite arrangement and produces small, inconspicuous flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, contributing to its natural propagation. Sideroxylon persimile is often found in moist, well-drained soils in forested areas.
